bwwExcerpt: Tom Hiddleston is back on stage, bringing Jamie Lloyd's six-month all-hands-on-deck salute to Harold Pinter at the West End theatre that bears his name to an immensely satisfying climax - one which not only re-confirms Betrayal as a modern masterpiece, built to last, but reassures us that Hiddleston...
rejectionReasoning: claude: This review is about a West End (London) production at a theater 'that bears his [Pinter's] name', not a Broadway show; kimi: This review covers the West End production at the Harold Pinter Theatre in London, not the current Broadway run.
